channel.title: Posts on Archania
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Archania

item.title: Seeking Deep Work
item.description: Having read Cal Newport’s Deep Work, I desire to document my pursuit in creating a better work-life balance by training my mind to be disciplined in this art of focus and “deep work”, a term that Newport contrasts with “shallow work”. I will write about my journey living a deep and focused life, pursuing my main interests of mathematics, music, spoken language and general nerd potpourri. My life in code:

item.title: Youtube Channels
item.description: Here are some YouTube channels that I enjoy: https://www.youtube.com/c/OddTinkering Relaxing gadget restorations https://www.youtube.com/c/TechnologyConnections Interesting technology discussion https://www.youtube.com/c/brilliantclassics Beautiful classical music https://www.youtube.com/c/bach Netherland Bach Society, the oldest ongoing baroque ensemble (so much Bach!) https://www.youtube.com/c/rousseau Excellent piano playing focusing on the hands Search German in Venice A very cool German with content on Venice Beach in Southern California as well as the Greater Los Angeles Area https://www.youtube.com/c/TheCriticalDrinker Hilarious critiques of film and series (adult language) https://www.

item.title: Simple Websites
item.description: Simple websites are great for quickly gathering information. I plan to keep this website simple and content-focused. Modern websites seem to have many layers of advertisements, audio, video and splash pages before getting to the desired content. Here are some websites that I think do a good job of focusing on content. I will revisit this page to add websites as I come across them. http://wiby.me/ Search engine for the classic web https://teddit.

item.title: Excel Formulae
item.description: Here I will keep a list of useful formulae in Microsoft Excel. These will probably also work in other spreadsheet software such as Gnumeric or LibreOffice Calc. Lookup all values with corresponding key (spill) =FILTER($$key_range,key=$$value_range) Lookup right to left =INDEX($$total_range,MATCH(key,$$key_range,FALSE),1) Two way lookup =INDEX($$value_only_range,MATCH(row_key,$$row_range,FALSE),MATCH(column_key,$$column_range,FALSE)) Get every nth column (negative n goes backward) =OFFSET($first_cell,0,n*(COLUMN()-COLUMN($first_lookup_cell))) Get every nth row (negative n goes backward) =OFFSET($first_cell,n*(ROW()-ROW($first_lookup_cell)),0) Check whether cell contains character =ISNUMBER(SEARCH(char, cell)) http://www.gnumeric.org/ https://www.

item.title: iSH App
item.description: Here is how I use the iSH app on my iPhone on iOS. This app is excellent. It basically puts an entire GNU/Linux distribution in an app with its own folder. From there I have nano, vi, vim etc for editing text files (eMacs would be weird over the small iOS keyboard). I can also keep and manage entire git repositories (which is how I can update this website on the go with my iPhone).

item.title: Mechanical Keyboards
item.description: I have been on a journey toward digital minimalism so I have been changing up some of my tools and habits (I am typing this on an iPhone Mini 13 which is probably the most responsive device I own). I even debate whether I should replace any of my devices since I can survive with what I have. On my journey, I decided to try out mechanical keyboards. My initial impression is favorable as I like the aesthetic of them.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Placeholder Text
item.description: Lorem est tota propiore conpellat pectoribus de pectora summo.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
